articles.title: Why Globalstar Shares Gained 36.5% Last Month
articles.content: In October, Globalstar analysts were excited about the long-term profit potential of Apple's satellite phone service.

articles.title: Foxconn to invest an additional $170 million in Lordstown Motors
articles.content: Foxconn Technology Group, the world’s biggest contract manufacturer for electronics, is deepening its investment in Lordstown Motors Corp.,  a once-troubled EV startup that recently began building its first all-electric pickup truck at a former General Motors Co. plant in Ohio.

articles.title: Dow ends more than 400 points higher as investors await midterm elections, inflation data
articles.content: After last week's Fed rate hike and strong jobs report, traders prepare for midterms and inflation data.

articles.title: All eyes on China as Apple and Foxconn outline zero-COVID issues. Meanwhile, cases are rising again in the U.S.
articles.content: China's strict zero-COVID policy was making headlines Monday after Apple and iPhone manufacturer Foxconn said over the weekend that restrictions will delay shipments of the iPhone 14.

articles.title: Apple’s iPhone sales could take another hit in December quarter
articles.content:
Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) is trading down on Monday after the multinational said it was temporarily cutting iPhone 14 production, citing the COVID restrictions at its primary facility in Zhengzhou, China. Apple could sell fewer iPhones this quarter The tech behemoth, over the weekend, said that the “Foxconn” facility that produces the majority of its […]
